intro: Geranium kotschyi subsp. kotschyi, commonly known as the Armenian geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Turkey. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of pink to purple flowers during the summer months, which are arranged in umbels. Its botanical characteristics include hairy stems and leaves, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the local flora diversity.
